title: (x) Looking for Latiara - Latin Bold {Stephen}
content:
Hello...

I’ve been given the unfortunate task of updating a design done by my predecessor at the company I now work for...

I print brochure that was done on a Mac, making extensive use of the font Latiara. We don’t have this font anywhere inhouse, and all I’ve been able to find online is a free downloadable zip that has nothing but a faulty bmap font and blank text file.

Most font stores don’t even have a listing for it... anyone know where I can find this thing?

example:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071107163517im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/latiara_3567.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Lettering on the 1971 Porsche 917/20 Coupé - "Pink Pig" - Pretorian {Mark}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071107163517/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27890 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Opernhaus Zürich poster by Josef Muller-Brockmann - Berthold Akzidenz-Grotesk {Matt Squire} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071107163517/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27983 "Go to next forum topic")
author: stef at fenix

comments.content: Looks like Photo-Lettering’s [Latin Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20071107163517/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=C.106304.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Jason+McCoy&sampleSize=45) came from a similar source. Also, [Barcelona](http://web.archive.org/web/20071107163517/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=barcelona).
That works like gangbusters! Thanks Stephen!
